instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage[/PLAIN]

Working on a MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 logic board that has both USB ports dead.  

Everything else seems to work properly and it's otherwise a very normal <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.  Inspection under a scope shows absolutely no signs of liquid damage, obvious burns on the board or probe points.

On both USB ports I get a good 5v on pin 1.  Pin 3 on both USB ports are idle until something is plugged in then they switche to 3v.  

Also.... I have the schematic for this model but not a "location" guide showing the placement of the various chips.  Any help would be appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
threads.message: Usually bad L4600/10 in the data lines, test continuity.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
threads.message: You wouldn't happen to have a layout showing the location of L4600/10would you ?  I have the actual schematics but not the diagram showing actual ship locations.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
threads.message: What you're looking for is a boardview and openboardview software. Google it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
threads.message: That was it, bad L4610.  Replaced and both USB ports are up and running fine now.  Thanks for the help.
